docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration will soon issue new Obamacare guidelines allowing people to enroll in health coverage after a March 31 deadline, but only under certain circumstances, according to sources close to the administration.

headline.main: U.S. to Allow Some People to Enroll in Obamacare After Deadline

docs.lead_paragraph: The new health care law helps some people, hurts others and confuses almost everyone. Hoping to simplify things a bit, The Associated Press asked its Twitter, Facebook and Google Plus followers for their real-life questions about the program and the problems they're running into as the March 31 deadline approaches to sign up for coverage in new insurance markets.

docs.lead_paragraph: For uninsured people, the nation's new health care law may offer an escape from worry about unexpected, astronomical medical bills. But for Stephanie Payne of St. Louis, who already had good insurance, the law could offer another kind of escape: the chance to quit her job.

docs.lead_paragraph: Oregon may have among the most dysfunctional online insurance exchanges in the nation.

headline.main: Health Care Exchange in Oregon Not Meeting High Hopes
headline.print_headline: Exchange in Oregon Not Meeting High Hopes

docs.abstract: Oregon may have among the most dysfunctional online health insurance exchanges in nation; only about 50,000 people in state have signed up for commercial insurance plan through exchange, well below state's goal, and majority of those enrolled using paper applications because website has been so unreliable.
docs.snippet: Oregon may have among the most dysfunctional online insurance exchanges in the nation.
